titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1136: De secretis mulierum

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: A copy of De secretis mulierum (also known as Secreta mulierum), a work frequently but erroneously attributed to Albertus Magnus since the late 13th century, with an unidentified commentary. Covers various issues of women's health. Some marginalia, cut off by page trimming. The first folio contains several other brief works.

supportDesc.extent: 54 leaves : 208 x 142 (173 x 111) mm. bound to 212 x 145 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i + 54 + i; [1-54]; modern pencil foliation, lower right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic cursive script.

decoDesc.decoNote: 2-line to 8-line red initials throughout; capitals touched in red.

origin.p: Written in Germany in the 15th century (Zacour-Hirsch).

keywords.term: Medicine, Magic, mystic, and spagiric--Early works to 1800
